citeinfo.origin: Persits, F.M., Wandrey, C.J., Milici, R.C., Manwar A.
citeinfo.title: Digital Geologic and Geophysical Data of Bangladesh

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team

citeinfo.othercit: Geologic and Geophysical Data of Bangladesh is one of a series of CD-ROMs presenting digital geologic maps of the world published by the U.S. Geological Survey.

descript.abstract: This coverage includes polygons and polygon labels that show areas with certain elevation levels of Bangladesh.
descript.purpose: To show areas with different average elevation levels of Bangladesh. The data provide government, geologic community, consultants, and the general public with a geographic base for small scale natural resource surveys, exploration and analysis.

(ESRI), and are used with their permission. End users are permitted to use these data sets for their own internal use, including derivative work, but are prohibited from using and redistributing these data individually or in a derivative work to third parties. Please refer to the "ATTACHMENT B" file (attach_b.txt) in the permssn directory of this CD-ROM for further information on ESRI's license agreement. ESRI is a registered trademark in the United States and either a trademark or registered trademark in all other countries where it is used, and ArcExplorer, Arc/Info, Arcview and Arcworld are trademarks of Environmental Systems Research, Inc.

attracc.attraccr: All the attributes other than standard Arc/Info attributes are of character type. - Attribute item "elev_m" was abstracted from insert on geologic map denoting average elevation level. - Standard verification of attribute reliability was performed by comparison with original insert. - Plots were created of the coverage, colored and labeled by item "elev_m" at the same scale, projection and map extent of the source maps for the purposes of review and examination. Review was conducted by persons uninvolved in the compilation.

dataqual.logic: Has been made by comparison with original insert.
dataqual.complete: This map was compiled from the small scale (1: 5,000,000) insert Md. Khurshid Alam, A.K.M.Shahidul Hasan, and Mujibur Rahman Khan (Geological Survey of Bangladesh), and John W. Whitney (United States Geological Survey), 1990, Geological Map of Bangladesh: Geological Survey of Bangladesh Publication, scale 1:1,000,000. 1. Original insert was scanned on large format scanner in gray-scale mode with resolution 200 dpi. 2. The scanned image was transformed to Lambert Conformal projection by ArcInfo REGISTER and RECTIFY utilities. 3. Reference data for transformation were Bangladesh state boundaries taken from paper map and compared with the same boundaries on master geological map. Overall RMS error of transformation was 1500 m (0.3 mm on original paper map). 4. On-screen digitization was performed using a rectified image as a backdrop in ArcInfo ARCEDIT. 5. Elevation values in meters were assigned to "elev_m" item of Feature Attribute Table (FAT) of "elev_g" coverage. 6. ArcInfo coverage was converted into .E00 files, then imported to ArcView by IMPORT 71 utility and saved as shape files. -----------------

horizpa.horizpar: 1. Original map is of 500 m. maximum accuracy (0.1 mm on paper map insert of 1:5,000,000 scale). 2. Scanned images are of 200 dot/inch resolution (0.1 mm on paper). Therefore fuzzy tolerance in ARC/INFO was set to 750 meters (three pixels). 3. Several steps were taken to vectorize scanned images as follows: 3.1. Country coverage "cntry95" was used as a reference for ArcInfo REGISTER and RECTIFY programs. Overall RMS error was 1500m. The vectorized coverage was edited and attributed in Arcedit using the gray-scale image of the source map as a background guide. 3.2. Line attributing of the ARC/INFO coverage was verified and corrected by comparing it with the gray-scale image as a background. ESRI's ArcWorld 1:3M data set is too small in scale for position accuracy estimation since original map was at 1: 1,000,000 scale, but to estimate relative positional accuracy such a comparison has been performed. Overall relative position error was estimated by randomly selecting set of locations on the ESRI World country coverage and comparing it with the state boundaries on the final geology coverage (b_geo). RMS error is 2.9 km (0.58 mm of the original paper map).

citeinfo.title: Generalized Physiographic Map of Bangladesh (insert on Geologic Map of Bangladesh).

pubinfo.pubplace: Bhutatta Rhaban, 153 Pioneer Road, Segun Bagicha, Dhaka,1000

procstep.procdesc: 1. Original insert was scanned on large format scanner in gray-scale mode with resolution 200 dpi. 2. The scanned image was transformed to Lambert Conformal projection by ArcInfo REGISTER and RECTIFY utilities.
Arcs and labels were digitized on screen in Arcedit with a fuzzy tolerance of 1500 meters and a weed tolerance of 500 meters, using the gray-scale image as a background guide.
Elevation values were assigned to "elev_m" item of Polygon Attribute Table (PAT) of "elev_g" coverage.
The master coverage was clean and built as a polygon coverage.
Paper maps were plotted from Arcplot at the same scale and extent as the original map sources and distributed with the original map source sheets to be examined for the purposes of content review.
The master coverage was edited in Arcedit, according to the results of the content reviews, adding or deleting arcs and labels as needed, and updating the attribution of labels as needed.
The master coverage was cleaned and built as a polygon coverage.
The master coverage was projected to the current Geographic coordinates.
The projected coverage was built with a fuzzy tolerance of 0.002 degrees.
The projected coverage was clipped to the current extent as a polygon coverage.
Coverage was converted to Arcview shapefile in Arcview 3.2.

attr.attrdef: range of elevations in an area.

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
